channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Trees overhanging mobile homes, 22nd July
item.description:
The overhanging trees from the public open space beside Orchard Park at the bottom of Green Lane in Hucclecote are causing distress to the residents of number 15 and 12. In the case of number 12, they are concerned that the branches could fall down and hit their conservatory while they are sitting in it during windy weather. They are also unable to have their property insured due to the closeness of the trees. The trees need to be cut back.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Orchard Park, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light obscured by vegetation., 22nd July
item.description:
The street light opposite the entrance to Orchard Park in Green Lane, Hucclecote is currently covered by overgrown branches. They need to be cut back.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester

item.title: Trees in front of my bungalow have become a thicket which is invading my garden, 22nd July
item.description:
I am struggling to cut back the thicket which is growing through my wire railings. A tree branch has grown across my land and is getting close to the roof. Originally there were two Holly trees but rowan trees grew in the middle of them followed by brambles. Seventeen years on it is a massive thicket which is completely out of control. It needs removing. Thank you. Pauline Pearson.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Reddings, The Reddings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Green or amber traffic light is not working problem, 22nd July
item.description:
This report is being logged retroactively. It was called in by Police Control at approx 23:10hrs on Monday 21st July 25. The report was initiall passed to Mayrise who returned the verdict that it was a set of permanent traffic lights which had been hit in an RTC, demolishing the signals and leaving wires exposed. Please see email trail for further details.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Highways work in Chestnut Place around lamp post, 22nd July
item.description:
Highways carried out tree/vegetation clearance around a lamp post opposite 2 Chestnut Place, GL53 0QE on 22/07/25. Whilst itâ€™s understandable that this work might have been deemed necessary, it began using noisy machinery before 8 am. More importantly, the site was left in a very untidy and unsightly state including logs and vegetation left behind which could have been removed. Overall the work appears to have been carried out without much care and attention, and is a bit of an eyesore frankly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Teasel Road, Shurdington, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
